node.title: Renewed calls to delay NT border reopening until Indigenous vaccination rates increase
node.alt: An Aboriginal man and woman in face masks speak with a health worker in a mask and face shield.
node.description: Aboriginal health groupsÂ appeal to the NT government to ease back on border reopening plans, saying the Territory's hospital system could be overwhelmed as Indigenous vaccination rates continue to lag.
node.content:
["Low vaccination rates in some Indigenous communities mean that while Australia is opening up, remote communities are at serious risk, according to health experts.", "Even as authorities try to contain the COVID-19 outbreak\u00a0in Katherine and Robinson River,\u00a0across the Territory\u00a0about half of Aboriginal communities still have a vaccination rate below 50 per cent, and about a quarter have rates of less than 25 per cent.", "John Paterson is the head of the Aboriginal Medical Services Alliance Northern Territory (AMSANT).", "He holds grave fears about the COVID-19 prognosis for the NT.", "\"We're expecting\u00a0more cases.\u00a0I don't want to alarm people but that's what we've\u00a0got to be prepared for,\" he said.", "\"This Delta virus is very, very fast-moving.\u00a0", "\"It will spread like wildfire throughout the community\u00a0and we're seeing that already, unfortunately.\"", "Chief Minister Michael Gunner has not been sugar-coating his expectations either", "\"The virus has killed 5.1 million people in the world\u00a0and I fear it will take lives in the Territory before the year is out,\" he said.", "
'People are frightened'
", "The umbrella organisation for Aboriginal health services across the country,\u00a0 National\u00a0Aboriginal\u00a0Community Controlled\u00a0Health\u00a0Organisation, is worried that while\u00a0some Indigenous communities are 100 per cent\u00a0fully vaccinated, others are lagging far behind.", "Pat Turner, the organisation's chief executive,\u00a0told the ABC's Coronacast\u00a0what was happening in the Territory was a warning to other jurisdictions where the rollout of vaccines to Indigenous communities is still lagging.", "\"I've always said that I wanted 100 per cent vaccination of our people before the country opened up. Well, obviously that hasn't happened,\" she said.", "\"The Northern Territory have now got their wake-up call and we should not have to wait until these infections get in before the health authorities get in and start the vaccinations.\u00a0They've got to do it now.\"", "", "
Locals come forward for testing in Katherine.(ABC News: Michael Franchi)
", "She said some religious groups had\u00a0brought\u00a0misinformation from the United States into Indigenous communities.", "\"Issues like that really have frightened people,\" she said.", "\"But they've also left people with the impression that they'll be saved by God,\u00a0whereas we're trying to say,\u00a0'If you get vaccinated, it's an act of love\u00a0and God wants you to practise that.'\"", "She said her organisation was working with pastors who were in favour of vaccination to communicate the health message in a way that could reach those who were hesitant.", "AMSANT's Mr Paterson said both the Aboriginal medical services and the NT government were redoubling their efforts to get more people vaccinated.", "\"We've been doing the door-to-door knocking and vaccination,\" he said.", "\"It's our view that if you aren't getting people coming to the clinics, then\u00a0you've got to take the vaccination to the people, even if that has required doing the vaccination administration process in their homes.", "\"That allows for the patient, or those who are considering vaccination, to ask questions on a one-to-one [basis]\u00a0in a bit more of a private environment, to get the responses back so they can make an informed decision.\"'", "", "
Jawoyn leader\u00a0Jawoyn Lisa Mumbin is appealing to people in communities around Katherine to get the COVID-19 vaccines.(ABC News: Jane Bardon)
", "Lisa Mumbin, who is the chairwoman of the Wurli Wurlinjang Aboriginal Health Service, which provides care to Aboriginal people in Katherine and Binjari, said health services were still up against a high level of worry and suspicion about the vaccines.", "She said the gap in providing vaccines to the NT, as well as further delays after changing\u00a0health advice regarding the AstraZeneca vaccine,\u00a0allowed misinformation to fill a vacuum on social media.", "\"I really believe that we've been doing our best in every way we can,\" he said.", "\"People are frightened of the COVID needle itself.", "\"There's been a lot of different information, a lot of that has kind of affected our mob and I'd just like to say,\u00a0please, people, we are in that risky time now, and encourage those who haven't been vaccinated, that [they]\u00a0need\u00a0to be vaccinated.\"", "Jack Green, a senior Garawa elder\u00a0of the Robinson River and Borroloola regions in the Gulf of Carpentaria, where another cluster is centred, is calling for more face-to-face vaccination information to be provided everywhere.", "\"I never got a needle and my family never got a needle, we're concerned about it because they never explained properly, you know,\" he told the ABC.", "\"I think they need to come down here and have a meeting with those people that never got a needle, they need to explain properly, we need to sit down and talk properly.\"", "
Hospital capacity in the Northern Territory
", "The Territory's Acting Chief Health Officer Charles Pain delivered a warning\u00a0about the capacity of the NT's two major hospitals in Darwin and Alice Springs to cope with an increase in COVID cases.", "\"We are under pressure already, our health system is under significant pressure all of the time,\" he said.", "", "
Robinson River, about a 10 hour drive from Katherine,\u00a0is home to about\u00a0350 people.\u00a0(Supplied: Sue Miller)
", "Dr Pain warned that even the current relatively small caseload, the\u00a0NT's contact tracing capacity was already stretched to breaking point.", "\"The number we are dealing with is pretty well our limit, so we are at our limit now,\" he said.", "\"But we do have the capacity to ask for help and we have several offers of help, from Western Australia, from South Australia.\"", "Both he and Mr Gunner are appealing for people, particularly in the many Indigenous communities where there are still low vaccination rates, to get inoculated.", "
A head start to get ready
", "The Territory has had a big head start to get ready, ahead of most other Australian jurisdictions\u00a0which have been grappling with community transmission for 19 months.", "Before this month the\u00a0NT had only experienced three short periods with COVID cases in the community: in March 2020, and then again in June and August 2021.", "COVID did not take hold and spread widely in the community.", "Health Minister Natasha Fyles said she was confident the Territory's\u00a0health and hospital system would be able to cope, based on modelling the NT government commissioned earlier this year from the Doherty Institute.", "There are 24 intensive care unit beds in Darwin and Alice Springs, for a population of 250,000, and 12 negative pressure hospital rooms for treating COVID patients.", "\"The Doherty Institute modelling shows that we can have between 30 and 100 cases a day at an 80 per cent\u00a0vaccination rate across the Northern Territory, and our health system can manage,\" Ms Fyles said.", "\"But it means we've had to make changes, so in the Top End we've gone to tier 3 and deferred elective surgery.\"", "That has happened at the Royal Darwin Hospital, while it deals with just a handful of sick COVID-positive patients.", "
'No federal response' to years of warning
", "The NT president of the Australian Medical Association, Dr Robert Parker, has been warning both the federal and NT governments by letter and in person for more than two years that the Territory's hospital system is already too understaffed and underfunded.", "\"It's all the things that I wrote to Minister [Greg] Hunt two years ago \u2014 the Territory's hospitals are two to three times as busy as other hospitals in Australia, and that's a really high activity level,\" Dr Parker said.", "", "
Robert Parker says training non-medical public servants in contract tracing should be explored\u00a0if case numbers rise.(ABC News: Jane Bardon)
", "\"When you're dealing with hospitals that are already stressed, an additional burden\u00a0such as COVID\u00a0just adds a massive extra burden to a very stressed hospital.\"", "Given the difficulty across Australia of getting more doctors and nurses, even if the NT could pay for them, Dr Parker thinks the Territory's hospitals are going to have to make do for now.", "But he said more training and preparation of non-health public servants to help with contact tracing was needed.", "
Appeal to go slower on border reopening
", "Even with remote Indigenous vaccination rates now rising faster in the areas where concentrated efforts are being made, AMSANT'S Mr Paterson feels the NT isn't ready for the Gunner government's current border re-opening plan.", "\"If we can delay that opening up of the borders for a few more weeks, that would really help us get those vaccination rates up to a more reasonable level,\" he said.", "As it tries to keep pace with the national reopening roadmap, the Gunner government has brought forward, rather than delayed, its plans to end the need for travellers to quarantine.", "It is now allowing people who are vaccinated to come into the NT from COVID-affected areas to quarantine at home for seven days, instead of 14.", "And from December 20 it is planning to remove the need for any quarantine as long as people return negative COVID tests.", "Mr Paterson is appealing to the government to bring his and other Aboriginal medical service leaders into the decision-making tent\u00a0and negotiate a more cautious reopening plan.", "\"We would prefer the vaccination rate to be between 90 and 95 per cent\u00a0before we open up and that should be the 12 [years] and above eligible population,\" he said.", "\"We understand and face the reality that we won't get there until early next year.\""]
